tasks.title: ğŸš€ Onboarding Guide â€” Set Up Mission Control
tasks.description:
Welcome to Mission Control! Follow these steps to complete your setup. Work through each subtask in order.

**Tip:** Click on a subtask to see detailed instructions. Check it off when done.

subtasks.title: 1. Enable GitHub Pages: Settings â†’ Pages â†’ Branch: main â†’ Save
2. Create GitHub Token: github.com/settings/tokens â†’ Generate (classic) â†’ Scope: repo
3. Connect Dashboard: Open your GitHub Pages URL â†’ Click 'Connect GitHub' â†’ Paste token
4. Install Tailscale: brew install tailscale && tailscale up
5. Enable Funnel: tailscale funnel 18789 â†’ Copy your URL
6. Generate Webhook Token: openssl rand -hex 32 â†’ Save it
7. Add GitHub Webhook: Settings â†’ Webhooks â†’ Add â†’ URL: https://YOUR-TAILSCALE-URL/hooks/github?token=YOUR-TOKEN
8. Test: Create a task, move to In Progress, verify MoltBot receives notification

comments.author: Mission Control
comments.text: Once all steps are complete, you can archive this guide or keep it as reference. Your setup is done when MoltBot responds to task changes!

tasks.title: ğŸ“– User Guide â€” How to Use Mission Control
tasks.description:
Learn how to use Mission Control effectively. Both you AND MoltBot can manage tasks!

**Two ways to manage tasks:**
â€¢ ğŸ‘¤ **You** â€” Use the Dashboard UI (drag & drop, buttons, forms)
â€¢ ğŸ¤– **MoltBot** â€” Uses CLI scripts or edits tasks.json directly

subtasks.title: â€” THE BOARD â€”
Columns: Permanent (recurring) â†’ Backlog â†’ In Progress â†’ Review â†’ Done
Drag & Drop: Move tasks between columns to change status
Click task card to open details and edit
â€” CREATING TASKS â€”
ğŸ‘¤ You: Click '+' button in any column header
ğŸ¤– MoltBot: Edits data/tasks.json or uses CLI
â€” TASK DETAILS â€”
Title: Short, clear name for the task
Description: Detailed instructions (Markdown supported)
Subtasks: Break work into smaller steps (checkable)
Comments: Add notes, feedback, or progress updates
Priority: High (ğŸ”´) / Medium (ğŸŸ¡) / Low (ğŸŸ¢)
Project: Organize tasks by project/category
â€” WORKFLOW WITH MOLTBOT â€”
1. Create task in Backlog with clear description
2. Move to 'In Progress' â†’ MoltBot gets notified via webhook
3. MoltBot works on task, updates subtasks & adds comments
4. MoltBot moves to 'Review' when done
5. You review: Approve â†’ Done, or add feedback â†’ back to In Progress
â€” DASHBOARD FEATURES â€”
ğŸ” Search: Filter tasks by text
ğŸ“ Project filter: Click project buttons to filter
âš™ï¸ Settings: Add/edit projects
ğŸ“¦ Archive: Store completed tasks out of sight
ğŸ‘¥ Team: See repo collaborators (if public)
ğŸ“š Docs: Built-in documentation
â€” MOLTBOT CAPABILITIES â€”
ğŸ¤– Can CREATE tasks (via CLI or JSON)
ğŸ¤– Can UPDATE task status, subtasks, comments
ğŸ¤– Can MOVE tasks between columns
ğŸ¤– Can DELETE/archive tasks
ğŸ¤– Receives WEBHOOK when you move tasks to In Progress

comments.author: Mission Control
comments.text: This guide stays in Permanent so you can always reference it. The subtasks aren't meant to be 'completed' â€” they're documentation!

tasks.title: Example Task â€” Delete me when ready!
tasks.description:
This is an example of what a real task looks like. Feel free to edit or delete it.

**Good task descriptions include:**
- What needs to be done
- Why it matters
- Any constraints or requirements
- Links to relevant resources

subtasks.title: First step of the task
Second step
Final step
